title: King Tvrtko I of Bosnia writes In castro nostro Vizoka vocatum from the Old town of Visoki.
text: King Tvrtko I of Bosnia writes In castro nostro Vizoka vocatum from the Old town of Visoki.

title: Tumu Crisis: Mongols capture the Emperor of China.
text: Tumu Crisis: Mongols capture the Emperor of China.

title: The Spanish fort of Sancti Spiritu, the first one built in modern Argentina, is destroyed by natives.
text: The Spanish fort of Sancti Spiritu, the first one built in modern Argentina, is destroyed by natives.

title: Lady Anne Boleyn is made Marquess of Pembroke by her fiancé, King Henry VIII of England.
text: Lady Anne Boleyn is made Marquess of Pembroke by her fiancé, King Henry VIII of England.

title: Adi Granth, now known as Guru Granth Sahib, the holy scripture of Sikhs, was first installed at Harmandir Sahib.
text: Adi Granth, now known as Guru Granth Sahib, the holy scripture of Sikhs, was first installed at Harmandir Sahib.

title: Battle of Tippermuir: James Graham, 1st Marquess of Montrose defeats the Earl of Wemyss's Covenanters, reviving the Royalist cause.
text: Battle of Tippermuir: James Graham, 1st Marquess of Montrose defeats the Earl of Wemyss's Covenanters, reviving the Royalist cause.

title: King Louis XIV of France dies after a reign of 72 years, which is the longest of any major European monarch.
text: King Louis XIV of France dies after a reign of 72 years, which is the longest of any major European monarch.

title: Catherine II of Russia endorses Ivan Betskoy's plans for a Foundling Home in Moscow
text: Catherine II of Russia endorses Ivan Betskoy's plans for a Foundling Home in Moscow

title: The Mission San Luis Obispo de Tolosa is founded in San Luis Obispo, California.
text: The Mission San Luis Obispo de Tolosa is founded in San Luis Obispo, California.

title: Massachusetts Bay colonists rise up in the bloodless Powder Alarm.
text: Massachusetts Bay colonists rise up in the bloodless Powder Alarm.

title: Juno, one of the largest asteroids in the Main Belt, is discovered by the German astronomer Karl Ludwig Harding.
text: Juno, one of the largest asteroids in the Main Belt, is discovered by the German astronomer Karl Ludwig Harding.

title: The high honor of Order of St. Gregory the Great is established by Pope Gregory XVI of the Vatican State to recognize high support for the Vatican or for the Pope, by a man or a woman, and not necessarily a Roman Catholic.
text: The high honor of Order of St. Gregory the Great is established by Pope Gregory XVI of the Vatican State to recognize high support for the Vatican or for the Pope, by a man or a woman, and not necessarily a Roman Catholic.

title: Narcissa Whitman, one of the first English-speaking white women to settle west of the Rocky Mountains, arrives at Walla Walla, Washington.
text: Narcissa Whitman, one of the first English-speaking white women to settle west of the Rocky Mountains, arrives at Walla Walla, Washington.

title: Saint Andrew's Scots School, the oldest school of British origin in South America, is established.
text: Saint Andrew's Scots School, the oldest school of British origin in South America, is established.

title: American Civil War: Battle of Chantilly: Confederate Army troops defeat a group of retreating Union Army troops in Chantilly, Virginia.
text: American Civil War: Battle of Chantilly: Confederate Army troops defeat a group of retreating Union Army troops in Chantilly, Virginia.

title: American Civil War: The Confederate Army General John Bell Hood orders the evacuation of Atlanta, ending a four-month siege by General William Tecumseh Sherman.
text: American Civil War: The Confederate Army General John Bell Hood orders the evacuation of Atlanta, ending a four-month siege by General William Tecumseh Sherman.

title: Franco-Prussian War: The Battle of Sedan is fought, resulting in a decisive Prussian victory.
text: Franco-Prussian War: The Battle of Sedan is fought, resulting in a decisive Prussian victory.

title: Cetshwayo ascends to the throne as king of the Zulu nation following the death of his father Mpande.
text: Cetshwayo ascends to the throne as king of the Zulu nation following the death of his father Mpande.

title: Emma Nutt becomes the world's first female telephone operator when she is recruited by Alexander Graham Bell to the Boston Telephone Dispatch Company.
text: Emma Nutt becomes the world's first female telephone operator when she is recruited by Alexander Graham Bell to the Boston Telephone Dispatch Company.

title: The army of Mohammad Ayub Khan is routed by the British at the Battle of Kandahar, ending the Second Anglo-Afghan War
text: The army of Mohammad Ayub Khan is routed by the British at the Battle of Kandahar, ending the Second Anglo-Afghan War

title: Over 400 people die in the Great Hinckley Fire, a forest fire in Hinckley, Minnesota.
text: Over 400 people die in the Great Hinckley Fire, a forest fire in Hinckley, Minnesota.

title: The Tremont Street Subway in Boston opens, becoming the first underground rapid transit system in North America.
text: The Tremont Street Subway in Boston opens, becoming the first underground rapid transit system in North America.

title: Alberta and Saskatchewan join the Canadian confederation.
text: Alberta and Saskatchewan join the Canadian confederation.

title: The International Federation of Intellectual Property Attorneys is established.
text: The International Federation of Intellectual Property Attorneys is established.

title: The armored cruiser Georgios Averof is commissioned into the Greek Navy. It now serves as a museum ship.
text: The armored cruiser Georgios Averof is commissioned into the Greek Navy. It now serves as a museum ship.

title: St. Petersburg, Russia, changes its name to Petrograd.
text: St. Petersburg, Russia, changes its name to Petrograd.

title: The last known passenger pigeon, a female named Martha, dies in captivity in the Cincinnati Zoo.
text: The last known passenger pigeon, a female named Martha, dies in captivity in the Cincinnati Zoo.

title: The Fountain of Time opens as a tribute to the 100 years of peace between the United States and Great Britain following the Treaty of Ghent.
text: The Fountain of Time opens as a tribute to the 100 years of peace between the United States and Great Britain following the Treaty of Ghent.

title: The Great Kantō earthquake devastates Tokyo and Yokohama, killing about 105,000 people.
text: The Great Kantō earthquake devastates Tokyo and Yokohama, killing about 105,000 people.

title: Ahmet Zogu declares Albania to be a monarchy and proclaims himself king.
text: Ahmet Zogu declares Albania to be a monarchy and proclaims himself king.

title: The first Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer animated cartoon, The Discontented Canary, is released to movie theatres.
text: The first Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer animated cartoon, The Discontented Canary, is released to movie theatres.

title: World War II: Nazi Germany and Slovakia invade Poland, beginning the European phase of World War II.
text: World War II: Nazi Germany and Slovakia invade Poland, beginning the European phase of World War II.

title: General George C. Marshall becomes Chief of Staff of the United States Army.
text: General George C. Marshall becomes Chief of Staff of the United States Army.

title: The Wound Badge for Wehrmacht, SS, Kriegsmarine, and Luftwaffe soldiers is instituted. The final version of the Iron Cross is also instituted on this date.
text: The Wound Badge for Wehrmacht, SS, Kriegsmarine, and Luftwaffe soldiers is instituted. The final version of the Iron Cross is also instituted on this date.

title: Switzerland mobilizes its forces and the Swiss Parliament elects Henri Guisan to head the Swiss Armed Forces (an event that can happen only during war or mobilization).
text: Switzerland mobilizes its forces and the Swiss Parliament elects Henri Guisan to head the Swiss Armed Forces (an event that can happen only during war or mobilization).

title: Adolf Hitler signs an order to begin the systematic euthanasia of mentally ill and disabled people.
text: Adolf Hitler signs an order to begin the systematic euthanasia of mentally ill and disabled people.

title: The United States, Australia and New Zealand sign a mutual defense pact, called the ANZUS Treaty.
text: The United States, Australia and New Zealand sign a mutual defense pact, called the ANZUS Treaty.

title: The Old Man and the Sea, the Pulitzer Prize-winning novel by Ernest Hemingway, is first published.
text: The Old Man and the Sea, the Pulitzer Prize-winning novel by Ernest Hemingway, is first published.

title: Iceland expands its fishing zone, putting it into conflict with the United Kingdom, beginning the Cod Wars.
text: Iceland expands its fishing zone, putting it into conflict with the United Kingdom, beginning the Cod Wars.

title: The Eritrean War of Independence officially begins with the shooting of the Ethiopian police by Hamid Idris Awate.
text: The Eritrean War of Independence officially begins with the shooting of the Ethiopian police by Hamid Idris Awate.

title: The first conference of the Non-Aligned Countries is held in Belgrade, Yugoslavia.
text: The first conference of the Non-Aligned Countries is held in Belgrade, Yugoslavia.

title: The Khmer–Chinese Friendship Association is banned in Cambodia.
text: The Khmer–Chinese Friendship Association is banned in Cambodia.

title: A coup in Libya brings Muammar Gaddafi to power.
text: A coup in Libya brings Muammar Gaddafi to power.

title: Trần Thiện Khiêm becomes Prime Minister of South Vietnam under President Nguyễn Văn Thiệu.
text: Trần Thiện Khiêm becomes Prime Minister of South Vietnam under President Nguyễn Văn Thiệu.

title: Attempted assassination of King Hussein of Jordan by Palestinian guerrillas, who attack his motorcade.
text: Attempted assassination of King Hussein of Jordan by Palestinian guerrillas, who attack his motorcade.

title: In Reykjavík, Iceland, American Bobby Fischer beats Russian Boris Spassky to become the world chess champion.
text: In Reykjavík, Iceland, American Bobby Fischer beats Russian Boris Spassky to become the world chess champion.

title: The SR-71 Blackbird sets (and holds) the record for flying from New York to London in the time of 1 hour, 54 minutes and 56.4 seconds at a speed of 1,435.587 miles per hour (2,310.353 km/h).
text: The SR-71 Blackbird sets (and holds) the record for flying from New York to London in the time of 1 hour, 54 minutes and 56.4 seconds at a speed of 1,435.587 miles per hour (2,310.353 km/h).

title: The American space probe Pioneer 11 becomes the first spacecraft to visit Saturn when it passes the planet at a distance of 21,000 kilometres (13,000 mi).
text: The American space probe Pioneer 11 becomes the first spacecraft to visit Saturn when it passes the planet at a distance of 21,000 kilometres (13,000 mi).

title: Major General Chun Doo-hwan becomes President of South Korea, following the resignation of Choi Kyu-hah.
text: Major General Chun Doo-hwan becomes President of South Korea, following the resignation of Choi Kyu-hah.

title: A coup d'état in the Central African Republic overthrows President David Dacko.

title: The United States Air Force Space Command is founded.
text: The United States Air Force Space Command is founded.

title: Cold War: Korean Air Lines Flight 007 is shot down by a Soviet Union jet fighter when the commercial aircraft enters Soviet airspace, killing all 269 on board, including Congressman Lawrence McDonald.

title: A joint American–French expedition locates the wreckage of the RMS Titanic.

title: The Crisis in Beslan commences when armed terrorists take schoolchildren and school staff hostage in North Ossetia (Russia); by the end of the siege three days later more than 385 people are dead (including hostages, other civilians, security personnel and terrorists).
